intro.title: Grounding in the Present
description: When waves of anxiety rise high, the mist can often cloud your vision, making you lose sight of the 'present moment'.
We may not be able to stop the waves right away, but to avoid being swept away, we must focus on the sensations touching the surface of your ocean.
Instead of the whirlpool of dizzying thoughts, try to focus on the actual sights and sounds surrounding your sea right now.
This process is a firm beginning that helps your ocean find its balance, even amidst high waves.
intro.contentDescription: This is a practice to awaken your senses and find the 'here and now' amidst the surging waves.
steps: 3. Focus on 3 things you can hear
intro.tip: Tip: Try to focus slowly on each sensation just as it is, without judgment.

step2.subject: 4 things you can touch
step2.example: Hardness of a chair, texture of clothes, etc.

step3.subject: 3 things you can hear
step3.example: Distant noise, the ticking of a clock, etc.

step5.subject: 1 thing you can taste
step5.example: The feeling in your mouth or the aftertaste of water

step.hint: * Tap the button once you've found each sensation

result.title: You are present in this moment
description: Amidst high waves, you have awakened your senses and faced the 'here and now' clearly.
The waves are still rolling, but you are now firmly present, no longer swept away.
Is your vision a bit clearer now? It is time to take a steady look at the waves rippling over your ocean.
